New Records: John Collins averaged 18.1 points, 7.8 rebounds, and 2.7 assists per game, with a 61.3 true shooting percentage early in the season, including 21 points, 8.3 rebounds, and 3.3 assists in November, and 28 points in two consecutive games; Kyle Filipowski contributed defensively, including switching on perimeter screens against Luka Dončić and showing growth in his defensive roles
Key Match Events: John Collins' increased offensive creation, including 2.7 assists per game, a career high, and his ability to generate his own offense and set up teammates; Filipowski's defensive contributions, particularly against Dončić, and the distribution of defensive responsibilities due to Taylor Hendricks' injury
Pre-Game Insights: Head coach Will Hardy emphasized John Collins' role in attacking switches and setting up teammates; Filipowski's defensive growth and understanding of defensive roles, including ice and drop coverage
Post-Match Reflections: Hardy praised Filipowski's defensive performance against Dončić and noted the distributed defensive responsibilities due to Hendricks' injury; Collins discussed his role expansion and offensive contributions
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article mentions the new white mountain jerseys set to debut in the 2025-26 season; the trend of increased playmaking from big men and the use of handoffs in the offense; the bench scoring strength and the role of the second unit
Others: The article provides insights into the team's strategies, rotations, and player developments, all relevant to the game against the Dallas Mavericks
